intro: Manettia pinastra, commonly known as the white-flowered manettia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and opposite, simple leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded habitats. The fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds.
